name: Alex Fan
short_description: Research Engineer at Pika working on generative video/image models. Studying Mathematics and Computer Science at MIT. USACO Finalist in 2021 and 2022.
long_description:
Alex Fan is a Research Engineer at Pika, where he works on solving engineering and research tasks related to generative video/image models and data curation. He is currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Mathematics and Computer Science at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), expected to graduate in 2026.

Alex has taken advanced coursework at MIT, including graduate-level Machine Learning, Advanced Algorithms, Advances in Computer Vision, Introduction to Inference, Abstract Algebra, Computation Structures, and Computational Cognitive Science.

Before MIT, Alex attended Lexington High School from 2019 to 2023, where he distinguished himself as a USACO (USA Computing Olympiad) Finalist in both 2021 and 2022, demonstrating exceptional skills in competitive programming.

With 664 followers and over 500 connections on LinkedIn, Alex is actively engaged in the AI and computer science community, showing particular interest in machine learning, computer vision, and generative AI technologies.
